mainQuestDesp.textId: In the land of Liyue by the sea, a city sits atop the solid bedrock. That city is Liyue Harbor, and it has flourished under the protection of its guardian Morax — also known as "Rex Lapis," the Geo Archon you have been looking for. You could not have arrived at a more fortuitous time, as the annual "Rite of Descension" has just begun. Every year on this day, Rex Lapis graces this land with his prophecy, giving guidance on the economic path Liyue should follow in the coming year.

text.textId: If you wanna find the Geo Archon, this is the only chance you'll get all year.
Guess it's a good thing Venti brought it up earlier, otherwise we definitely would've missed this year's Rite of Descension.
Do you know when it is?
Do you know where it is?
Uhh... might be today, might also be tomorrow...
Well, Venti brought up the time, but Paimon... knows nothing about where it is... Ehe.
Look, we're already in Liyue so let's go ask some of the locals.
Oh, right. About the Geo Archon, "Morax..."
Did you know? The Mora that we use is named after this god.
But it's seen as impolite for people from outside Liyue to refer to the Geo Archon by that name.
So we should refer to the Geo Archon by the name Rex Lapis, like the people of Liyue do.
Oh! Are you also visitors here for the Rite of Descension?
To think I've lived in Liyue all these years and never come to see this before.
I guess it's like they say. Locals never visit the tourist spots.
I wish you well on your travels! Liyue always welcomes you!
Thanks! So we wanna know where to go if we wanna see the Rite of Descension?
Hmm... You're not at all close. Not to mention that if I gave you directions, as outlanders, you'd get lost along the way.
So better to head to Yujing Terrace, to the high ground.
It's the highest place in the harbor — sounds like the best place for trying to communicate with deities, no?
Rite of Descension... Oh yeah, that reminds me, isn't that today?
Once a year, Rex Lapis bestows upon us his divine prediction, guiding us on how to run Liyue for the coming year.
Last year it was the Yuheng of the Liyue Qixing that was given the honor of asking for the divine prediction.
Liyue Qixing?
Yuheng?
Ooh! Paimon knows this one!
Mondstadt is to freedom as Liyue is to contracts. Liyue has a strong focus on business and trade.
The Liyue Qixing — the seven leaders of the seven enterprises of Liyue — hold true control over Liyue.
That's what outlanders always say.
But true control over Liyue will always be held by Rex Lapis.
The Qixing is comprised of mere mortals. Rex Lapis is a god. Mondstadt's god is nowhere to be seen, whilst our god is forever with us.
Stay in Liyue long enough and you'll see...
Given that you just left your godless city, it's time you experienced what it's like to be in a city whose god has walked with it through all of history.
Great! Then we can start our experience off with the Rite of Descension.
Good choice. Then get going. To the high ground.
You too wish to bear witness to the Rite of Descension? Me too, we all do!
As a businessman myself, how could I not take interest in Liyue's most important business trends?
The seventeen predictions given last year made more than a few ripples throughout the industry.
What's more, there has been a rumor going around that the Tianquan herself, Ningguang, has been acting secretly in the shadows...
She wants the rocks created by Geo Vision holders to be exempt from taxation.
Wow... that's some super professional legal stuff that is!
Haha. To be on the pulse of the predictions and the market is what makes this harbor what it is.
Among The Seven, Rex Lapis is the oldest deity.
His keen sense of strategy is well trusted among his people.
Understanding the predictions as soon as possible can make all the difference in making your fortune!
F—Fortune! So where can we see this Rite of Descension anyway?
Hmm... You're not at all close. Not to mention that if I gave you directions, as outlanders, you'd get lost along the way.
So better to head to Yujing Terrace, to the high ground.
It's the highest place in the harbor — sounds like the best place for trying to communicate with deities, no?
#Paimon heard that the best time to make a wish is today, during the Rite of Descension. {NICKNAME}, wanna give it a try?

subQuestTitle.textId: Pray and make a wish at Yujing Terrace

text.textId: Oh, you also want a little adepti luck too?
Haha, seems you know a lot! Making a wish during this time is sure to get you the blessings of both the Adepti and Rex Lapis himself.
I've already made my wish, so you can take this.
#I wish I could find my {M#sister}{F#brother} soon...
Great, thanks!

subQuestTitle.textId: Pray and make a wish at Yujing Terrace

text.textId: Your first time in Liyue? Actually, it's my first time to see the Rite of Descension too.
Ah, look! That's Ms. Ningguang of the Liyue Qixing!
Only those who have control in Liyue can preside over the Rite of Descension.
Oh yeah, not sure if you knew, but most of the adepti appear in the form of various beasts.
I heard that when attending these kinds of formal occasions, Rex Lapis himself appears as a celestial cross between two of Liyue's ancient mythical creatures...
...Sorry, I shouldn't interrupt your wish. Please, take this.
I wish I could get some leads from the Geo Archon...
Great! Now that we're all done with the wishing, guess we can just wait here for things to get started.
Hmm, who knows how long that Ms. Ningguang lady is gonna take.

subQuestTitle.textId: Join the crowd and wait for the rite to begin

texts.textId: Under Ningguang's direction, the Rite begins right on time, and Liyue's deity shows up as promised. But as the clouds disperse, the crowds watch in horror as the lifeless body of their lord drops onto the offering table. After inspecting the scene for a brief moment, Ningguang utters the unfathomable words: "Rex Lapis has been killed! Seal the exits!"

text.textId: Wha... What's going on!?
Did she just say Rex Lapis is...
The Geo Archon... is... DEAD!?
Oh no, the Millelith! Looks like they're nabbing suspects who got too close.
Paimon's freaking out. The killer is amongst us!
Wait... we got close... are we suspects!?
Wait, where are you going?
(It was a god we faced off against when we first arrived in this world too...)
(We can't fall into their hands...)

texts.textId: You cautiously make your way out, avoiding the watchful gaze of the Millelith, but before you make it far from the scene of the crime, one misstep alerts them to your presence. Just when it seems like there's no way out, a mystery man suddenly lands in front of you and helps you escape the Millelith for good.

text.textId: *panting* Phew... Paimon's exhausted...
I'm even more beat.
Just what muscles does magical floating use exactly?
So insensitive! You have no idea just how tiring floating arou— Wait!
Just who are you exactly?
Call me Childe.
Childe? What, so we're supposed to dote on you?
Haha, no no, not at all. It's an alias of sorts.
In Mondstadt, I don't suppose you came across a "Signora" by any chance?
Signora... Childe...
You're Fatui! One of The Harbingers!
Oh, no. Don't worry, I'm not looking for a fight.
Signora gave you quite the bad impression huh? Tsk, that woman... Can't say I'm a fan either.
Right, let's forget all about her, shall we? I'm here to help you.
Help?
I don't need help from the Fatui.
Go. Leave.
Yes. Help.
Come now, don't be like that.
Sure, I may be one of the Harbingers, but hear me out.
I'm not a bad guy... Okay perhaps I'm kind of a bad guy, but I'm not here to give you any trouble.
Would it be too much to ask for you to keep the sword sheathed?
#Haha, I thank you for your knightly nobility, {NICKNAME}.
I heard of your deeds in Mondstadt, so I couldn't help but notice you during the proceedings back there.
And because I had my eye on you the whole time, I know it wasn't you. Someone else was clearly behind it.
But... regrettably, given I'm a Fatui envoy from Snezhnaya... there's no way I'd be trusted after something of this magnitude.
The ruling Qixing of Liyue has always been overly suspicious of us.
Well can you honestly blame them?
Hahaha. Guess I shouldn't try to deny that.
Okay, sure. Maintaining a distance between strangers is probably a good idea. Either way, I'm already used to it at this stage.
But right now, if you want to clear yourselves of any suspicion — you need to get yourselves to Northland Bank.
Staying here isn't an option. As the old Liyue saying goes: "The walls have ears."

subQuestTitle.textId: Talk to Childe at the Northland Bank

text.textId: Northland Bank...
Correct. This bank was opened here in Liyue by Snezhnaya.
Though everyone knows Liyue is the most enterprising in Teyvat, Snezhnaya is not short of change either.
Yeah well, poorer nations don't seem the type to have diplomats that come around acting the way yours do towards the Knights of Favonius.
Eh-hehehehe...
Here, let me give you this.
This is a...
I'm not sure, exactly. Sometimes, all money can buy is "things" and not a name for oneself.
All I know is that it's a sigil. A sigil to keep the "mighty and illuminated adepti" from bringing harm to you.
Adepti?
If you head north from the harbor, then west from Guili Plains, you will eventually reach a stone forest known as Jueyun Karst.
The people of Liyue believe it to be the abode of the adepti.
They really believe that?
Isn't it just a legend?
Legend or not, they believe it. As such, offerings to the adepti are made at its borders. Nobody dares venture in.
But I have no need for believing — not when I know for a fact that the adepti truly exist.
Hate to admit it but your Fatui intel seems alright. But, why would we go looking for adepti anyway?
Ha, oh my little friend. There are plenty of reasons mortals seek the blessings of adepti.
Money, health, love... But you... you will go for justice.
Justice?
The Qixing will already have dispatched the Millelith. They'll be seeking out the assassin from amongst the onlookers.
But how could a mere mortal kill a god that can sweep aside entire armies? Rex Lapis never gave up his power as a god.
This level of crude response is beyond what is called for. How suspicious...
You think they're trying to hide the true culprit?
You think the Qixing did it and they're trying to pin it on someone else?
Or... to hide something else. Hard to say.
Your thinking is even more radical than my own, Honorary Knight.
Even now, the Northland Bank wouldn't be able to hold the Millelith off for long, but the adepti can clear you of any wrongdoing.
Liyue was founded by the Geo Archon and the adepti — of course, it was built by force.
Look for them. And be faster than the Qixing's messengers, so you may give your version of events first.
If there is anyone that can help you in Liyue now, it can only be the mighty and illuminated adepti.

mainQuestDesp.textId: During the rite, the appointed moment arrived. Yet when the clouds parted, a divine carcass crashed down to earth, knocking all the offerings over. Amid the chaos and confusion, the Qixing ordered that the assassin be arrested. Unable to prove your innocence, you were forced to accept the help of Childe of the Fatui, and as suggested by him, you are now headed for Jueyun Karst, a hidden abode where the adepti dwell...

subQuestTitle.textId: Search for the adepti in Jueyun Karst
Meet the adepti in Jueyun Karst

text.textId: And who might we be? Those that dare enter Jueyun Karst?
I was sent here.
Please take a look at this.
A Sigil of Permission... Many a season has passed since one was last in the presence of such an item.
He before you is the mighty and illuminated adeptus, Moon Carver. Speak, traveler. What business have you here?
Actually...
It's the assassin! They dared to flee here to Jueyun Karst!
Sir, we've already stepped too far into Jueyun Karst ourselves...
We... Argh, there's no choice. Apprehending the assassin is top priority, we must press on!
...disturbing our borders.
See them gone. One will not have interruption.
We've digressed. State your purpose, traveler.
Well...

texts.textId: You tell Moon Carver what happened at Yujing Terrace...

text.textId: Preposterous...
PREPOSTEROUS!!!
The Liyue Qixing... utterly disappointing.
How could someone possibly assassinate Rex Lapis during the Rite of Descension...
And then place suspicion upon the attendees!?
Traveler, of the unjust accusations placed upon you, one has become aware.
The mind knows its answer. Though one must consult with one's fellows, lest the mind be misguided.
Go. Take your Sigil of Permission, carry with you a message.
Who should I look for?
Where should I go?
Mountain Shaper and Cloud Retainer can be found here. Only fate will decide if you shall find them — only fate.
There exists a Conqueror of Demons, a Guardian Yaksha. Go to Wangshu Inn. There you shall seek him.

mainQuestDesp.textId: You came across an adeptus, "Moon Carver." Seeing the keepsake you bore, he lent you his aid and protected you from the Millelith soldiers pursuing you. Upon learning of Rex Lapis' passing and the unjust accusations laid against you, Moon Carver expressed disdain for the Qixing's actions and began to suspect that they were behind what happened. He has sent you to find several other adepti and deliver a message to them.

text.textId: Oh, this seems to be Wangshu Inn.
Compared to Jueyun Karst this place seems basic. Are we really gonna find an adeptus here?
Let's take a look. Paimon reckons he'll be on the balcony. Heh, doubt we're going to find him in the kitchen.

texts.textId: You take a good look around the balcony, but there's no one to be seen. You stop to admire the view — when suddenly, an adeptus appears

text.textId: A Sigil of Permission? You came prepared.
Though this only prevents me from hurting you myself. Doesn't stop you from getting hurt in other ways.
Uhh... Paimon doesn't get it...
Too much contact with our world is breaking the rules.
Mortal souls are not as robust as those of adepti, nor can your blood carry this level of adeptal energy.
It's for your own good. Leave. Now.

texts.textId: Without waiting for you to explain, Xiao disappears...

text.textId: Wait a sec, we came here to...
Argh! Paimon's... peeved! All he does is think about himself!
Paimon wants to give him an ugly nickname... but if you tick off an adeptus, the only thing you'll probably ever find in treasure chests is cabbages! Bleurgh!
Ugh... Guess we should go ask the boss lady of the inn about just how she manages to talk to adepti.

subQuestTitle.textId: Ask the boss lady about Xiao

text.textId: Tell me about that adeptus
Oh? You've already met Xiao?
Not bad. Not often he's in a good enough mood to agree to see people.
That's his good mood?
Oh yes, the adepti are very hard to come by. Many people go their whole lives praying to them, never once actually getting to see one.
When the Geo Archon built Liyue, he borrowed power from the adepti.
But most of them only know how to protect Liyue by fighting.
So for many millennia, it has instead been humans who have led Liyue, whilst the adepti have lived hidden away on the outskirts.
You really know a lot, huh boss lady.
It's not "boss lady," it's just boss...
Anyway, seen as you have the favor of the adepti, things should be a lot easier.
Well... If you wanna know my opinion... If you keep Xiao in a good mood, things should be okay.
Good mood? Can't really imagine what a "good mood" looks like for that "Vigilant Yaksha."
Haha! Will be interesting, won't it?
(Come to think of it, I've never seen him smile either...)
How 'bout this — you go see the chef for a bowl of Almond Tofu, and a plate of whatever it is you are best at making.
Almond Tofu is one of the few human foods Xiao likes. The other dish is up to you.
#Up to us, eh...? {NICKNAME}, what do you think you're the best at cooking?
Satisfying Salad I guess?
Perhaps a Maha Manjusaka Hot Pyro Slime?
Really hard to screw that one up, right?
Wow! Never heard of that one! Paimon wants to try it!
But, if we're gonna be cooking for an adeptus, perhaps the Satisfying Salad would be the safer choice...
Can't you see I'm on a break kid? Scram.
Excuse me, we'd like an Almond To—
Scram!
Whoa, this chef guy's service is about as good as that Wagner guy's back in Mondstadt.
It's for the boss, Goldet.
I see. If it's for the boss, then guess I don't have a choice now, do I?
But my heart's not really in it right now, not enough to make a dessert as painstaking as Almond Tofu.
And why is that?
A fencer's hand must be steady, so too must the hand of a chef.
But my hands, I'm... they're not steady...
Because ahh, a traveler once told me that this inn... is haunted.
And then, just now — just now! In the kitchen... I saw something... something not right.
(This chef looks so intimidating, but speak of ghosts and he becomes weak.)
I keep thinking... even Wangshu Inn isn't safe. I—I can't keep a steady hand for something like Almond Tofu.
#Alright {NICKNAME}. In the name of high-quality Almond Tofu, we need to go check this kitchen out.
Doesn't seem to be anyth—

texts.textId: A ghost runs across the room before your very eyes...

subQuestTitle.textId: Tell Smiley Yanxiao about what happened

text.textId: What!? You saw it too! There really is a ghost!
What... How can I...
Okay, so he's useless now. What do we do?
Forget it. Let's just go see the boss lady again.
Hehe... Scared of something so insignificant. Hard to believe he was once a notorious bandit.
You don't seem that afraid of ghosts, boss lady.
Gods and ghosts, I've seen it all before.
Come to think of it, others don't seem to know there's an adeptus here at the inn, except for the boss lady...
Shh!
Say any more and you'll be divulging my little secret.
Right. Best you two be off. Go see to it that little ghost doesn't go scaring anybody else.
Not that I'm ordering you around. It's like the adeptus said, mortal souls are not as robust as those of the adepti.
So as to not be harmed when dealing with the adepti, you can start by practicing with that ghost.
Sounds good.
But how should we persuade the ghost?
But how should we persuade the ghost?
There is a calligraphy painting in the inn known as the Witness Sigil. It's been in circulation for over a thousand years. Go take a look at it.
Once you have, look for a place outside where you can see the exact same Witness Sigil formation.

subQuestTitle.textId: Find a place where you can see the whole Witness Sigil

text.textId: #Th—There she is! So scary... {NICKNAME}, quick, you... you grab her.
She's trying to get away!
We have to follow her. If it's as the boss lady said, she won't disappear like last time!
Argh! She doesn't know when to give up!
This old, decrepit Ruin Guard... Surely it's not... possessed!?
♪ Silly-churl, billy-churl ♪...
Phew... Finally caught you. Paimon's pooped.
♪ Silly-billy hilichurl ♪ ...
Haunting things isn't nice! Little girl, are you listening?
♪ Chilly-churl, frilly-churl ♪ ...
Now listen here young lady!
Okay.
Dusky Ming won't tease the travelers at the inn anymore.
#Next time {NICKNAME} can come play with Dusky Ming.
If you don't come and play, Dusky Ming will come find you~

subQuestTitle.textId: Tell Smiley Yanxiao about what happened

text.textId: Wh-What... You really got the ghost to promise to stop haunting the inn?
Wow... You really are something...
I am in your debt.
Please wait a moment. I'll make you the smoothest, silkiest bowl of Almond Tofu.
Haha, my hands are steadier than ever now that she's gone.
...You two again.
Wait! Don't go disappearing again.

texts.textId: You give the food to Xiao...

text.textId: What's this?
It's your favorite, Almond Tofu! As well as this distant traveler's best dish — a Satisfying Salad.
#{NICKNAME}! Quick! Tell him everything before he finishes eating!
Rex Lapis... How could this be?
I... can't imagine it. Though times have changed, I've never imagined a Liyue without him.
The ruling Qixing... Just what role have they played in this?
I will seek Moon Carver, Mountain Shaper, and Cloud Retainer. It is time they too made their decisions.
Will the adepti take over his role in Liyue?
Will the adepti interrogate the Qixing?
Adepti do not turn on their responsibilities.
I have my reasons to not want to be tainted by the mortal realm, but... responsibilities are responsibilities.
Our god is the God of Contracts after all.
Wait! Paimon still has one last question.
Hmm?
That... Dusky Ming. She's...
When conquering demons, on occasion, you can come across spirits who have never hurt anyone, yet are also not yet able to be moved on.
So I asked the innkeeper and the boss if they could keep her here for a time.
So really, Wangshu Inn was looking after her! Really keeping a wide range of business going, huh!
